This card provides {C} Energy.\n\nThe Pokémon this card is attached to can use any attack from its previous Evolutions. (You still need the necessary Energy to use each attack.)
Your Pokémon in play have no Retreat Cost, except Pokémon-GX and Pokémon-EX.
If this Pokémon is your Active Pokémon, once during your turn (before your attack), you may switch 1 of your opponent’s Benched Pokémon with their Active Pokémon.

Once during your turn (before your attack), you may put any Stage 1 card from your hand onto this Pokémon to evolve it. You can’t use this Ability during your first turn or the turn this Pokémon was put into play.

Once during your turn (before your attack), you may use this Ability. All Energy attached to your Pokémon are {R} Energy instead of their usual type until the end of your turn. (This includes cards that come into play on this turn.)
Once during your turn (before your attack), you may attach a basic Energy card from your discard pile to this Pokémon.
Whenever you attach a Pokémon Tool card that has "Fairy Charm" in its name from your hand to this Pokémon during your turn, you may leave your opponent’s Active Pokémon Confused.
Once during your turn (before your attack), you may discard the top card of your deck. If it’s a basic Energy card, attach it to 1 of your Pokémon.

Once during your turn (before your attack), if this Pokémon is your Active Pokémon, and if there are 66 or more damage counters on your Benched Pokémon, you may use this Ability. If you do, you win this game.
Once during your turn (before your attack), if this Pokémon is in your discard pile, you may put it onto your Bench. If you do, put 1 damage counter on 2 of your opponent’s Benched Pokémon.
This Pokémon may have up to 2 Pokémon Tool cards attached to it. If it loses this Ability, discard Pokémon Tool cards from it until only 1 remains.
If this Pokémon is your Active Pokémon and is damaged by an opponent’s attack (even if this Pokémon is Knocked Out), the Attacking Pokémon is now Asleep.
This Pokémon takes 30 less damage from attacks (after applying Weakness and Resistance).
Once during your turn (before your attack), you may heal 20 damage from your Active {G} Pokémon.

Once during your turn (before your attack), you may search your deck for Jumpluff, put this Pokémon and all cards attached to it in the Lost Zone, and put that Jumpluff in its place. Then, shuffle your deck.
Once during your turn (before your attack), if this Pokémon is your Active Pokémon, you may leave your opponent’s Active Pokémon Asleep.
When you play this Pokémon from your hand onto your Bench during your turn, you may search your deck for up to 3 basic Energy cards and discard them. Then, shuffle your deck.
Once during your turn (before your attack), if this Pokémon is your Active Pokémon, you may have your opponent switch their Active Pokémon with 1 of their Benched Pokémon.
Once during your turn (before your attack), you may look at the top 2 cards of your deck and put them back in any order.
Once during your turn (before your attack), if this Pokémon is your Active Pokémon, and if you have 35 or more cards in your hand, you may use this Ability. If you do, you win this game.
Once during your turn (before your attack), you may remove a Special Condition from your Active Pokémon.

When you play this Pokémon from your hand to evolve 1 of your Pokémon during your turn, you may prevent all damage done to this Pokémon by your opponent’s attacks until the end of your opponent’s next turn.
Whenever you attach an Energy card from your hand to 1 of your Pokémon, except with an attack, Ability, or Trainer card, attach up to 2 Energy cards to that Pokémon instead of 1.

When you play this Pokémon from your hand to evolve 1 of your Pokémon during your turn, you may leave your opponent’s Active Pokémon Paralyzed and Poisoned. If you do, put 3 damage counters instead of 1 on that Pokémon between turns.
If your opponent’s Pokémon is Knocked Out by damage from this Pokémon’s attacks, put that Pokémon and all cards attached to it in the Lost Zone instead of the discard pile.
If this Pokémon has any Energy attached to it, it has no Retreat Cost.

If this Pokémon is your Active Pokémon and is damaged by an attack from your opponent’s Pokémon-GX or Pokémon-EX (even if this Pokémon is Knocked Out), put damage counters on the Attacking Pokémon equal to the damage done to this Pokémon.

Once during your turn (before your attack), if this Pokémon is your Active Pokémon, and if your opponent has 12 or more Supporter cards in the Lost Zone, you may use this Ability. If you do, you win this game.
When you play this Pokémon from your hand to evolve 1 of your Pokémon during your turn, you may put a Shedinja from your discard pile onto your Bench.

Once during your turn (before your attack), if this Pokémon is in your hand, you may reveal it. If you do, look at the top card of your opponent’s deck and put this Pokémon in the Lost Zone. If that card is a Supporter card, you may put it in the Lost Zone. If your opponent has no cards in their deck, you can’t use this Ability.
As long as this Pokémon is on your Bench, whenever your opponent plays a Supporter card from their hand, prevent all effects of that card done to your {Y} Pokémon in play.

When you play this Pokémon from your hand to evolve 1 of your Pokémon during your turn, you may search your deck for up to 2 Item cards, reveal them, and put them into your hand. Then, shuffle your deck.
Once during your turn, when this Pokémon moves from your Bench to become your Active Pokémon, you may move any number of Energy from your other Pokémon to it.
Once during your turn (before your attack), if this Pokémon is on your Bench, you may shuffle it and all cards attached to it into your deck.
Prevent all damage done to this Pokémon by attacks from your opponent’s Pokémon that have 2 or fewer Energy attached to them.

Once during your turn (before your attack), you may use this Ability. Choose 1 of your Basic Pokémon in play. If you have a Stage 2 card in your hand that evolves from that Pokémon, put that card onto the Basic Pokémon to evolve it. customchoice.sm8_116.hardshellevolution: Would you like to prevent all damage done to this Pokémon by your opponent's attacks until the end of their next turn?

Play 2: Switch 1 of your opponent's Benched Pokémon with their Active Pokémon.

customchoice.sm8_184.mixedherbs.button2: Play 2: Heal 90 damage and remove all Special Conditions from your Active Pokémon.

decks.sm8.pcd.blazingvolcano.name: Blazing Volcano
decks.sm8.pcd.stormcaller.name: Storm Caller
playmat.prompt.aetherfoundationemployee: Choose Pokémon that have "Alolan" in their names to put into your hand.
playmat.prompt.attachspecificenergy: Choose a Pokémon to attach the {0} Energy to.
playmat.prompt.attachspecifictool: Choose a Pokémon to attach the {0} Pokémon Tool card to.
playmat.prompt.cardtolostzone: Choose a card to put in the Lost Zone.
playmat.prompt.faba: Choose a Pokémon Tool or Special Energy attached to 1 of your opponent's Pokémon, or any Stadium card in play, to put in the Lost Zone.
playmat.prompt.genericpokemonforbench: Choose Pokémon to put onto your Bench.
playmat.prompt.lostblender: Choose 2 cards to put in the Lost Zone.
playmat.prompt.mina: Choose a {Y} Energy card to attach to 1 of your Pokémon.
playmat.prompt.morty: Choose 2 cards to shuffle into your opponent's deck.
playmat.prompt.movememoryenergy: Select a Pokémon to move the Memory Energy to.
playmat.prompt.netball: Choose a Basic {G} Pokémon or a {G} Energy card to put into your hand.
playmat.prompt.revealcards.opponent: Your opponent has revealed these cards from their hand:
playmat.prompt.revealcards.player: You have revealed these cards from your hand:
playmat.prompt.sm8_100.spiritjuggling: Choose any number of Benched Pokémon to discard. This attack does 30 more damage for each Benched Pokémon you discard in this way.
playmat.prompt.sm8_11.multiply: Choose a Hoppip to put onto your Bench.
playmat.prompt.sm8_117.diamondgate: Choose a Supporter card and a Stadium card to put into your hand.
playmat.prompt.sm8_13.floralpathtothesky: Choose a Jumpluff to put in Skiploom's place.
playmat.prompt.sm8_137.makeamess: Choose up to 2 Trainer cards to discard.
playmat.prompt.sm8_149.dreamfeargx: Choose 1 of your opponent's Benched Pokémon to shuffle into their deck.
playmat.prompt.sm8_154.almightyevolution: Choose a Stage 1 Pokémon to put onto this Pokémon.
playmat.prompt.sm8_158.milkcannon: Choose any number of Moomoo Milk cards to reveal.
playmat.prompt.sm8_16.energydrink: Choose 2 basic Energy cards to attach to your Pokémon.
playmat.prompt.sm8_16.freshsqueezed: Choose basic Energy cards to discard.
playmat.prompt.sm8_165.mountainpass.reve: Reveal this card and use its Ability.
playmat.prompt.sm8_180.lifeforest: Choose a {G} Pokémon to heal 60 damage and remove all Special Conditions from it.
playmat.prompt.sm8_31.beemarch: Choose up to 3 Combee to put onto your Bench.
playmat.prompt.sm8_34.breezeaway: Choose any number of your Pokémon in play to put them, and all cards attached to them, into your hand. (Choosing all of your Pokémon in play will cause you to lose the match.)
playmat.prompt.sm8_52.mindblown: Choose {R} Energy to put in the Lost Zone.
playmat.prompt.sm8_57.happydelivery.a: Choose any number of your Benched Pokémon to attach Pokémon Tool cards to.
playmat.prompt.sm8_57.happydelivery.b: Choose a Pokémon Tool card to attach to this Pokémon.
playmat.prompt.sm8_67.harmonics: Choose another Energy to attach to the Pokémon.
playmat.prompt.sm8_72.electrocharge: Choose {L} Energy cards to attach to this Pokémon.
playmat.prompt.sm8_74.salvage: Choose Item cards to shuffle into your deck.
playmat.prompt.sm8_8.quickripeningherb: Choose a Stage 2 Pokémon to put onto your Basic Pokémon.
playmat.prompt.sm8_86.fullvoltagegx: Choose basic Energy cards to attach to your Pokémon.
playmat.prompt.sm8_88.energygaze: This is your opponent's hand. Your attack will do 60 more damage if they're holding an Energy card.
playmat.prompt.sm8_94.getlost: Choose cards to put in the Lost Zone.
playmat.prompt.sm8_95.vesseloflife: Choose a Pokémon to attach Shedinja to.
playmat.prompt.sm8_97.distortiondoor: Choose 2 of your opponent's Benched Pokémon to put 1 damage counter on each of them.
playmat.prompt.sm8_97.shadowimpact: Choose 1 of your Pokémon to put 4 damage counters on.
product.sm8.booster.6card.name: Sun & Moon—Lost Thunder
product.sm8.pcd.blazingvolcano.name: Blazing Volcano
product.sm8.pcd.blazingvolcano.sell-text: Release the red-hot power of the Legendary Pokémon Entei! This slow-building deck combines the power of Fire and Grass types to fan a small flame into a raging inferno. Burn your way to victory with the Blazing Volcano theme deck!
product.sm8.pcd.blazingvolcano.tagline: From Small Sparks to a Raging Volcano!
product.sm8.pcd.stormcaller.name: Storm Caller
product.sm8.pcd.stormcaller.sell-text: Ride the wind with the surging power of the Legendary Pokémon Raikou! This high-voltage deck has the support to charge up potent hits—and runs some risks for the big Knock Out. Master the lightning with the Storm Caller theme deck!
sleeve.sm8.etb.zeraora.name: Elite Trainer Zeraora Card Sleeves
specialvisualizations.sm8_10.trappingthr: Item and Supporter cards have no effect on this Pokémon during this turn.
specialvisualizations.sm8_146.mysterious: This player's {Y} Pokémon are immune to all effects of the opponent's Supporter cards.
specialvisualizations.sm8_148.effectspor: If this Pokémon is damaged by an opponent's attack, this Ability will leave the Attacking Pokémon Asleep.
specialvisualizations.sm8_172.electropow: This player's {L} Pokémon's attacks do more damage to the opponent's Active Pokémon.
specialvisualizations.sm8_182.lusaminepr: Damage done to this player's Ultra Beasts by attacks is prevented.
specialvisualizations.sm8_42.blazingener: All Energy attached to this player's Pokémon are {R} Energy instead of their usual type.
specialvisualizations.sm8_86.thunderclap: This player's Pokémon that have {L} Energy attached have no Retreat Cost.
specialvisualizations.sm8_93.shadytail: {*} Pokémon in play can't attack and have no Abilities.
specialvisualizations.specificattackdoes: This Pokémon's {0} attack does more damage.
